turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about AMD 700 chipset series.
turn.1: When was the AMD 780 chipset series released?
turn.2: The 780 chipset series, first launched in China on January 23, 2008, and released worldwide on March 5, 2008 during CeBIT 2008, mobile chipsets (M740G, M780G and M780T chipsets) were released on June 4, 2008 during Computex 2008 as part of the Puma mobile platform and the 790GX chipset was released on August 6, 2008, while some other members released at a later date in 2008. The 785G was announced on August 4, 2009.
turn.3: What's the difference between the 780 and 760 series?
turn.4: Besides the use of SB600 southbridge for earlier releases of several members in late 2007, all of the above chipsets can also utilize newer southbridge designs, the SB700, SB710 and the SB750 southbridges.
turn.5: Is there anything else interesting about the 780 series?
turn.6: Future server chipsets will also utilize the server version (SB700S/SB750S) of the southbridges.
turn.7: What are the features of the southbridges?
turn.8: Features provided by the southbridge are listed as follows: The ATI CrossFire X technology supports multiple video cards to be connected to enhance the visual display and 3D rendering capabilities of the system, using AFR mode and/or scissor mode.
turn.10: Alternatively, systems with multiple video card CrossFire X setup will support multiple display monitors up to eight.
turn.11: Is there anything else interesting about the 780 series?
turn.12: For the AMD 790FX chipset, the CrossFire X technology allows up to 4 video cards to be connected, made possible as the chipset supports four physical PCI-E x16 slots.
